quiz_results.question: Which of the following fall(s) under the “essential characteristics” of cloud computing?
quiz_results.explanation: A, B, and C are essential characteristics of cloud computing, while Latency is not.

quiz_results.question: “Google Doc” is an example of
quiz_results.explanation: C is correct because Google Docs is a Software as a Service (SaaS).

quiz_results.question: Business-Process-as-a-Service is not a part of XaaS.
quiz_results.explanation: B is correct because BPaaS is a part of the XaaS framework.

quiz_results.question: Network Function Virtualization involves the implementation of _______ function in software that can run on a range of industry-standard servers ______________.
quiz_results.explanation: D is correct; NFV implements network functions in software to run on standard hardware.

quiz_results.question: Which are the following applications for SaaS (Software as a Service) architecture?
quiz_results.explanation: A and B are correct as they are common applications of SaaS architecture.

quiz_results.question: Web access to commercial software is one of the SaaS characteristics in the cloud computing paradigm.
quiz_results.explanation: A is correct; web access is a key characteristic of SaaS.

quiz_results.question: In the case of the client-server model: Statement (i) Virtualization is a core concept; Statement (ii) system can scale infinitely.

options.text: None of the statements is correct

quiz_results.explanation: D is correct; neither statement accurately describes the client-server model.

quiz_results.question: Client-server model is always load-balanced.
quiz_results.explanation: B is correct; the client-server model does not guarantee load balancing.

quiz_results.question: PaaS (Platform as a Service) brings the benefits: (i) Creation of software (ii) Integration of web services and databases.
quiz_results.explanation: C is correct; PaaS enables both software creation and integration.

quiz_results.question: Which of the following is false?

options.text: Private cloud is dedicated solely to an organization.
Community cloud is a composition of public and private cloud.
Public cloud is available to the general public.

quiz_results.explanation: B is false because a community cloud is shared by multiple organizations, combining elements of both public and private clouds.
